messages.content: What is a standard in CDXA?
In CDXA, a "standard" is a collection of security requirements. Each "standard" has a version number, description, an owner, and a list of requirements.
What does every requirement have in CDXA?
In CDXA every requirement has an Identifier, a Title, Text, Descriptions (an array), OpenCRE Identifier (where possible), Parent (to support a hierarchy), and External References.
Can I create my own security standard in CDXA?
Yes, in CDXA you're free to create your own security standard. It could be a subset or superset of an existing standard.
What is the CDXA version of the NIST Secure Software Development Framework (SSDF) 1.1?

The CDXA version of the NIST Secure Software Development Framework (SSDF) 1.1 is [CDXA-SSDF](https://github.com/CycloneDX/official-3rd-party-standards/blob/main/standards/NIST/SSDF/nist_secure-software-development-framework_1.1.cdx.json).
What is the CDXA version of the PCI Secure SLC Standard v1_1?

The CDXA version of the PCI Secure SLC Standard v1_1 is [CDXA-PCI-SSLC](https://github.com/CycloneDX/official-3rd-party-standards/blob/main/standards/PCI_Security_Standards_Council/Secure_SLC/pcissc-secure-slc-1.1.cdx.json).
What is the CDXA version of the Build Security In Maturity Model (BSIMM) v13?
The CDXA version of the Build Security In Maturity Model (BSIMM) v13 is [CDXA-BSIMM](https://github.com/CycloneDX/official-3rd-party-standards/blob/main/standards/BSIMM/bsimm-v13.cdx.json).
What is the CDXA version of the OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) 4.0.3?

The CDXA version of the OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) 4.0.3 is [CDXA-OWASP-ASVS](https://github.com/CycloneDX/official-3rd-party-standards/blob/main/standards/OWASP/ASVS/asvs-4.0.3.cdx.json).
What is the CDXA version of the OWASP Mobile Application Security Verification Standard (MASVS) 2.0.0?

The CDXA version of the OWASP Mobile Application Security Verification Standard (MASVS) 2.0.0 is [CDXA-OWASP-MASVS](https://github.com/CycloneDX/official-3rd-party-standards/blob/main/standards/OWASP/MASVS/masvs-2.0.0.cdx.json).
What is the CDXA version of the OWASP Software Component Verification Standard (SCVS)?
The CDXA version of the OWASP Software Component Verification Standard (SCVS) is [CDXA-OWASP-SCVS](scvs-1.0.0.cdx.json).
What are CycloneDX Attestations (CDXA)?

CycloneDX Attestations (CDXA) represent an automated approach to enhancing security and compliance across various standards. CDXA allows for the specification of mitigation strategies. This feature ensures that organizations can transparently communicate their efforts to address potential shortcomings, thereby maintaining trust and integrity in the face of compliance challenges.
What is the purpose of claims in CDXA?
Claims serve as the medium through which organizations can articulate their argument for meeting a specific requirement.
What are the key components of a claim in CDXA?
A claim has two key parts: a target and a predicate. Claims often restate the requirement using specific terms related to the defenses in the system.
What is the target property in a CDXA claim?

Each claim has a target that is the subject of the claim. The target might be the specific name of an entire system, a module, a process, a team, a business unit, or a company. In many cases, the target is simply an interpretation of the requirement for the current attestation.
What is the predicate property in a CDXA claim?

Each claim also has a predicate that states what is being claimed about the target. Once again, this is often a specific interpretation of the requirement that details exactly what was done to meet the requirement.
What properties does the table in this document list for claims?
bom-ref, target, predicate, mitigationStrategies, reasoning, evidence and counterEvidence. Signature is also a property, although not defined in the table.
Describe the bom-ref property in the context of a CDXA claim.
An identifier, unique to the CDXA document, that identifies the claim.
Describe the target property in the context of a CDXA claim.
The bom-ref to a target representing a specific system, application, API, module, team, person, process, business unit, company, etc... that this claim is being applied to.
Describe the predicate property in the context of a CDXA claim.
The specific statement or assertion about the target.
Describe the mitigationStrategies property in the context of a CDXA claim.
The list of bom-ref to the evidence provided describing the mitigation strategies. Each mitigation strategy should include an explanation of how any weaknesses in the evidence will be mitigated.
Describe the reasoning property in the context of a CDXA claim.
The written explanation of why the evidence provided substantiates the claim.
Describe the evidence property in the context of a CDXA claim.
The list of bom-ref to evidence that supports this claim.
Describe the counterEvidence property in the context of a CDXA claim.
The list of bom-ref to counterEvidence that supports this claim.
What does CycloneDX Attestations enable organizations to do?
CycloneDX Attestations enables organizations to build an argument explaining how they meet security requirements.
What is the purpose of `evidence` in substantiating CDXA claims?

`Evidence:` A list of references to evidence that supports this claim. Evidence can include metrics, observations, test results, analysis, surveys, sampling, expert opinion, and more. It's important to not only present output as evidence, but also to capture the metadata about how the evidence was created, any relevant configuration details, expertise, etc...
What is the purpose of `Counter Evidence` in substantiating CDXA claims?

`Counter Evidence:` A list of references to evidence that contradicts this claim. Often, evidence will be created that directly or partially contradicts a claim. For example, a security testing tool discovers a gap in security defenses, such as a lack of authorization on a particular interface.
What is the purpose of `Mitigation Strategy` in substantiating CDXA claims?

`Mitigation Strategy:` If the evidence is not compelling or counter evidence is present, the producer can detail their plans for improving conformance in this section. Ideally, the strategy should detail the change or enhancement, the rough schedule, and the expected effect on the evidence supporting the claim.
List the properties that make up evidence in CDXA
bom-ref, propertyName, description, data, created, expires, author, reviewer and signature.
Describe `bom-ref` property in the context of CDXA evidence
An identifier, unique to the CDXA document, that identifies the evidence.
Describe `propertyName` property in the context of CDXA evidence
The reference to the property name as defined in the CycloneDX Property Taxonomy.
Describe `description` property in the context of CDXA evidence
The written description of what this evidence is and how it was created.
Describe `data` property in the context of CDXA evidence
The output or analysis that supports claims.
Describe `created` property in the context of CDXA evidence
The date and time (timestamp) when the evidence was created.
Describe `expires` property in the context of CDXA evidence
The optional date and time (timestamp) when the evidence is no longer valid.
Describe `author` property in the context of CDXA evidence
The author of the evidence.
Describe `reviewer` property in the context of CDXA evidence
The reviewer of the evidence.
What is `Reasoning` in CDXA and what purpose does it serve?

Simply providing claims and evidence is not sufficient to determine whether the claim was satisfied. We need some reasoning that explains how all the evidence, counter evidence, and mitigation strategy work together to support the claim. The best reasoning is simple and direct, and ties back to the claim as a straightforward argument.
What is the purpose of `External References` in CDXA?
A claim can reference any systems, sites, and information that may be relevant, but are not included with the BOM. They may also establish specific relationships within or external to the BOM.
What is the purpose of `Signature` in CDXA?
Enveloped signature in [JSON Signature Format (JSF)](https://cyberphone.github.io/doc/security/jsf.html).
What happens when something fails to meet its intended specifications or established regulations?
Non-conformance of requirements occurs when something - a product, service, process, or system - fails to meet its intended specifications or established regulations.
How does CycloneDX Attestations document conformance?

CycloneDX Attestations documents conformance through an `attestation` that maps `requirements`, `claims`, `counterClaims` and a `conformance`. The `conformance` documents the ability of the `claims` to satisfy the `requirements`.
What fields does the conformance have in CDXA?
The conformance has three fields: `score`, `rationale`, and `mitigationStrategies`.
How do I document non-conformance in CDXA?

Instead of specifying that a `claim` is non-conforming, the `attestation` will have a lower `conformance` `score` for the portion of the requirement not met. Additionally the `rationale` describes what the non-conform is as a text statement, and the `mitigationStrategies` is `evidence` that alleviates the risk of the non-conformance.
What are mitigation strategies?
Mitigation strategies are actions taken to reduce the severity or likelihood of a negative outcome. They are an essential part of risk management by reducing risk associated with non-conformance.
How are mitigationStrategies documented?

CycloneDX Attestations documents `mitigationStrategies` as bomLinks to `evidence`. This `evidence` details the action taken to mitigate the non-conformance. Each mitigation strategy should include an explanation of what part of the non-conformance is being addressed. This explanation should be included as part of the `conformance` `rationale` or within the `description` of the `evidence`.
What is a POAM?

A POAM (Plan of Action and Milestones) is a process used in cybersecurity and risk management to document risks, and is an opportunity to strengthen or “harden” your system through carefully planned improvements.
What are some common contexts where POAMs are used?
Common contexts where POAMs are used: NIST Cybersecurity Framework (CSF), Federal Information Systems Management Act (FISMA), Defense Contract Management Agency (DCMA) and Internal risk management.
What is `counterEvidence`?

Much like `evidence` is used to document supporting a `claim`, `counterEvidence` is used document `evidence` that contradicts a `claim`. This can provide verification that 100% conformance is not met.
Why is signing important in CycloneDX?
CycloneDX supports signing to ensure the authenticity and integrity of the attestations. This is crucial for Verification of Origin, Non-Repudiation, and Integrity Assurance.
What are the two main groups that can be signatories?
The personas that could sign claims, evidence, standards, or attestations can be categorized into two main groups: Producers and Verifiers.
Who are the likely producers of claims, evidence, standards, or attestations?
Software developers, software distributors, build or deployment tools and software supply chain security tools.
Who are the likely verifiers of claims, evidence, standards, or attestations?
Organizations consuming software and regulatory bodies or auditors.
What digital signing methods does CycloneDX support?

CycloneDX supports multiple digital signing methods to accommodate various preferences and security requirements. These methods include: XML Signature (xmlsig), JSON Signature Format (JSF), Detached Signatures.
Does CycloneDX support analog signatures, and if so, when might they be used?

CycloneDX supports use of analog signatures for signing CycloneDX attestations. Analog signatures are typically used for signing paper documents and are not as secure as digital signatures. However, they can be useful in some cases where digital signatures are not available or practical. The use case can be to verify the identity of a software supplier and attesting to the compliance of software with regulations.
What format does CycloneDX recommend for analog signatures?
Signature Image, Signature Text, Signature Date and Signature Location and Signature Type.
What is an example of a JSON representation of a digital signature in a CycloneDX attestation?
What is an example of an XML representation of a digital signature in a CycloneDX attestation?

<attestation>
 <signature algorithm="RS512">
 <publicKey>
 <kty>RSA</kty>
 <n>qOSWbDOGS31lv3aUZVOgqZyLVrKXXRfmxFQxEylc...</n>
 <e>AQAB</e>
 </publicKey>
 <value>HGIX_ccdIcqmaOpkxDzKH_j0ozSHUAUyBxGpXS...</value>
 </signature>
</attestation>
